thread.title: Landscape Photographer of the Year Awards: the best of autumn
thread.title_full: Landscape Photographer of the Year Awards: the best of autumn

author: Telegraph Staff
title: Landscape Photographer of the Year Awards: the best of autumn
text:
MORE... 
Photographer Charlie Waite reveals his favourite locations for autumn photography in Britain and reviews images from the Landscape Photographer of the Year Awards 
Autumn is an exciting time for me, not only because of the wonderful colours in Britain’s landscape, but because it’s when the results of the awards I founded, Landscape Photographer of the Year, are released and we share the wonderful work of our winners. There are 150 beautifully crafted images in this year’s Awards book and the following selection from the shortlist reflects the changing moods of Britain in autumn. 
-- 
Kidston Force, Yorkshire Dales 
The Yorkshire Dales offers great locations for photographing autumn colours reflected in water: the River Wharfe rushing through the Strid Gorge; pools at the base of Hardraw Force near Hawes or Janet’s Foss waterfall at Malham being just a few. The velocity of the moving water has to be skillfully gauged, as it will determine which shutter speed to use. Too long and the water is formless; too short and the image is over-literal and without rhythm, the strands of water becoming a solid mass. Picture: Bill Ward
